participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

RLS_01.LongName: Do you have, or have you had, recurrent uncomfortable feelings or sensations in your legs while you are sitting or lying down?

RLS_02.LongName: Do you, or have you had, a recurrent need or urge to move your legs while you were sitting or lying down?

RLS_2A.LongName: Did you answer YES to either question 1 or 2 above?

RLS_03.LongName: Are you more likely to have these feelings when you are resting (either sitting or lying down) or when you are physically active?

RLS_04.LongName: Do these feelings usually start when you are resting (either sitting or lying down)?

RLS_05.LongName: If you get up or move around when you have these feelings do these feelings get any better while you actually keep moving?

RLS_06.LongName: Which times of day are these feelings in your legs <u>most</u> likely to occur?

RLS_07.LongName: Which times of day are these feelings in your legs <u>least</u> likely to occur?

RLS_08.LongName: Will simply changing leg position by itself once without continuing to move usually relieve these feelings?

RLS_9.LongName: Are these feelings ever due to muscle cramps?

RLS_9b.LongName: If so, are they always due to muscle cramps?

RLS_10.LongName: Do these feelings occur only when sitting or only when lying down?

Levels.4: Both when sitting and when lying down

RLS_11.LongName: When you actually experience the feelings in your legs, how distressing are they?

RLS_12.LongName: In the past 12 months, how often did you experience these feelings in your legs?

RLS_13.LongName: Approximately how old were you when you first noticed these feelings in your legs?

RLS_14.Description:
The following questions must be answered as indicated for Clinically Typical (Definite) Restless Leg Syndrome: 1. yes; 2. yes; 3. resting; 4. yes; 5. yes; 6. must not be about equal or only morning; 7. must not be about equal or only evening or night; 8. Does not usually relieve or Don’t know; 9a. no or 9b. no; 10. both sitting and lying OR only when lying | Calculation = iif ([RLS_01]==1, 
iif ([RLS_02]==1, 
iif ([RLS_03]==1, 
iif ([RLS_04]==1, 
iif ([RLS_06]>1, 
iif ([RLS_06]<6, 
iif ([RLS_08]==2, 
iif ([RLS_9]==1, 
iif ([RLS_9b]==1, 
iif ([RLS_10]>=3, 'YES', 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO')

RLS_15.Description:
A diagnosis of a probable RLS (not typical of clinical cases) is given in 2 cases. 
In the first case is the following: 1. yes; 2. yes; 3. resting; 4. yes; 5. yes; 6. must not be about equal or only morning; 7. must not be about equal or only evening or night; 8. Does not usually relieve or Don’t know; 9a. no or 9b. no; 10. only when sitting.  In the second case, all items are answered as follows: 1. no; 2. yes; 3. resting; 4. yes; 5. yes; 6. must not be about equal or only morning; 7. must not be about equal or only evening or night; 8. Does not usually relieve or Don’t know; 9a. no or 9b. no; 10. both sitting and lying OR only when lying. | Calculation = iif ([RLS_01]==1, 
iif ([RLS_02]==1, 
iif ([RLS_03]==1, 
iif ([RLS_04]==1, 
iif ([RLS_06]>1, 
iif ([RLS_06]<6, 
iif ([RLS_08]==2, 
iif ([RLS_9]==1, 
iif ([RLS_9b]==1, 
iif ([RLS_10]==2, 'YES', 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 
iif([RLS_02]==1,
iif ([RLS_03]==1, 
iif ([RLS_04]==1, 
iif ([RLS_06]>1, 
iif ([RLS_06]<6, 
iif ([RLS_08]==2, 
iif ([RLS_9]==1, 
iif ([RLS_9b]==1, 
iif ([RLS_10]>=3, 'YES', 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 'NO'), 
'NO')
